skill.name: rn-navigation
skill.description: Expo Router navigation patterns for React Native. Use when implementing navigation, routing, deep links, tab bars, modals, or handling navigation state in Expo apps.
skill.summary: Expo Router navigation patterns for React Native. Use when implementing navigation, routing, deep li...
skill.author: CJHarmath

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown content with code examples. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access. Contains only educational content about Expo Router navigation patterns.

content.user_title: Implement React Native navigation with Expo Router
content.value_statement: Building navigation in React Native requires understanding file-based routing, deep linking, and complex state management. This skill provides ready-to-use patterns for tab bars, modals, dynamic routes, and authentication flows.
actual_capabilities: Implement file-based routing structure with Expo Router
Configure tab bar navigation with layout groups
Create dynamic routes using URL parameters
Set up modals with presentation options
Configure deep linking for universal links
limitations: Requires Expo Router library to be installed in project
Does not provide actual navigation component implementations
Does not include authentication state management code
Does not generate complete navigation configuration files

use_cases.title: Mobile navigation architecture
use_cases.description: Design navigation structure for React Native apps using Expo Router file-based routing conventions.

use_cases.title: Deep link integration
use_cases.description: Configure universal links and URL schemes to handle external navigation into specific app screens.

use_cases.title: Navigation patterns library
use_cases.description: Standardize navigation implementation across team projects with documented patterns and examples.

prompt_templates.title: Basic navigation setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the rn-navigation skill to show me how to set up a basic Expo Router navigation structure with tabs and authentication flow.

prompt_templates.title: Dynamic routing
prompt_templates.prompt: Use rn-navigation to demonstrate how to implement dynamic routes with parameters in Expo Router.

prompt_templates.title: Deep linking
prompt_templates.prompt: Use rn-navigation to show how to configure deep linking with universal links for iOS and Android.

prompt_templates.title: Modal patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Use rn-navigation to create a modal presentation pattern with proper navigation stack configuration.

output_examples.input: Show me how to set up Expo Router with tabs and a modal
output: Add tab group in app/(tabs)/_layout.tsx with Tabs component
Configure tab screens: home.tsx and profile.tsx
Add modal screen with presentation: 'modal' option
Use router.push('/modal') to open modal from any screen

best_practices: Use layout groups (parentheses) to organize navigation hierarchy without affecting URL structure
Replace navigation state with router.replace after authentication to prevent back navigation to login
Test deep links early using npx uri-scheme CLI before app deployment
anti_patterns: Mixing different navigation paradigms (Stack + Tabs + native navigation) without clear boundaries
Using useSearchParams instead of useLocalSearchParams for URL parameter access
Hardcoding deep link paths instead of using constants or configuration files

faq.question: Does this skill work with plain React Native without Expo?
faq.answer: No. Expo Router specifically requires Expo or Expo Go. For plain React Native, use React Navigation library instead.

faq.question: What is the maximum depth for nested navigation stacks?
faq.answer: Expo Router does not enforce a strict limit, but deeply nested stacks may cause performance issues. Keep navigation depth under 5 levels.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with Redux or Zustand state?
faq.answer: Yes. Navigation state is separate from app state. Use context providers or state management libraries alongside Expo Router.

faq.question: Does this skill collect or store any user data?
faq.answer: No. This is a documentation-only skill that provides reference patterns. No data is collected, stored, or transmitted.

faq.question: Why are my deep links not working on physical devices?
faq.answer: Ensure the app is built as a development build using expo prebuild. Test links using the npx uri-scheme command. Verify associatedDomains configuration.

faq.question: How does Expo Router compare to React Navigation?
faq.answer: Expo Router uses file-based routing with native navigation. React Navigation uses JavaScript-based navigation with more customization. Choose based on project needs.
